title: Software Fault Prediction using Artificial Neural Networks
bulletPoints: Developed an artificial neural network with Keras and TensorFlow for software fault prediction and trained it on the Camel 1.6 software bug dataset, resulting in a testing accuracy of 84.36% with an ROC AUC of 0.8 on cross-validation.

title: Human Resources Analytics
bulletPoints: Performed cleaning, EDA, statistical modeling and machine learning on the HR data-set from Kaggle, building 3 models, of which the decision tree classifier predicted the employees that would leave with an accuracy of 96.8%.

title: Distributed Microblogging Website Engine
bulletPoints: Developed a distributed engine for a twitter-like application using Phoenix/Elixir, with posts, hashtags, user-mentions, re-posts, and subscriptions, which on simulation with 1000 concurrent users, performed 500 tasks/second and delivered 200 notifications/second in real-time via websockets to a front-end client developed with Vue.js.

title: Simulation of Distributed Algorithms - Gossip, Push-Sum and Tapestry DHT
bulletPoints: Developed the algorithms, routing and communication between processes (peers) on the Erlang VM, with the Gossip and Push-Sum algorithms reaching 100% convergence for 5000 nodes arranged in the 3D torus and honeycomb topologies, and the Tapestry DHT performing 100,000 lookups with a maximum of 6 hops in 20 minutes.

title: Analysis of Transcripts of TED Talks
bulletPoints: Developed a text mining project to identify features using tf-idf, topics using LDA and named entities in TED talks and gathered insights, such as topic trends over time.

title: Design of Swarm Intelligence Methodologies Applying Machine Learning for Terrain Mapping
bulletPoints: Worked as a member of a 3 person team that developed 3 robots that cooperatively generate the map of an unknown environment using the ORB-SLAM2 algorithm on data recorded from the cameras mounted on them.
Developed the swarm dispersion algorithm on the ARGoS simulator and implemented it on the robots.
Devised a reinforcement training algorithm to improve the robotsâ€™ movement on uneven terrain.

title: Web Application for Storyhoot LLP
bulletPoints: Developed and managed a social networking web application using Ruby on Rails that allowed sharing GIFs with subscribed users for our start-up Storyhoot, which grew to 1000 users.
